definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: This is the sign of a person who is respected.
sentences.chinese: 那是一小我被敬服的标识表记标帜。

sentences.english: Respect and love, that is the point, rather than beating them.
sentences.chinese: 敬服与爱，那是重面，而没有是打击他们。

sentences.english: Please protect equipment and facilities, if there is any defile, you should compensate as its price.
sentences.chinese: 请阁下敬服设施装备，如有污损按价赔偿。

sentences.english: They don't know how to respect others .
Is there any aspect you particularly admire, and why?
sentences.chinese: 画中哪些方面使您特别敬服，为什么敬服？

sentences.english: Is there any aspect you particularly admire, and why?
sentences.chinese: 画中哪些方面使您特别敬服，为什么敬服？

sentences.english: She simply loved and venerated him.
sentences.chinese: 她爱他，并且极其单纯地敬服他。

definition: to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
to hold sb in the same regard as one would a god (idiom)
